text: Daniel Howard Milano (born September 10, 1972 in Northport, New York) is an American voice actor, puppeteer, writer and director. He was one of the creators of the FOX sitcom Greg the Bunny and performed the title character as well as Warren the Ape and The Wumpus. He is also one of the voice actors and writers of Robot Chicken, and was nominated for an Emmy for writing Robot Chicken: Star Wars II. ==Filmography== ===Television=== List of television productions by Dan Milano Year Title Role Notes 2002–2006 Greg the Bunny Co- creator, voice actor, narrator, puppeteer 2005–present Robot Chicken He-Man, Lex Luthor, Yogi Bear, Garfield, Papa Smurf, Monterey Jack, Stu Pickles, Scrappy-Doo, Steven Spielberg, Woody Woodpecker, Big Bird, Other Characters Voice actor, writer 2009 Titan Maximum Willie Palmer, Various voices voice actor, writer 2010 Warren the Ape Various Co-creator, voice actor & spinoff of Greg the Bunny 2010-2013 MAD Lex Luthor, Raphael, Pokémon Professor, Tenderheart Bear, Dagwood Bumstead, Hawkeye, Mike Wazowski Luke Skywalker, Loki, Soundwave Voice actor 2013 Star Wars Detours Himself Voice actor, writer, Cancelled 2015–2017 Dawn of the Croods Grug, Various voices voice actor, writer 2020 Glitch Techs BITT, Various voices Co-Creator, voice actor 2020 The George Lucas Talk Show Self Episode: "Revenge of Return of the Jedi", with Eric Robles ===Video games=== List of voice performances in video games Year Title Role Notes 2006 Dirge of Cerberus: Final Fantasy VII Incidental characters ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1972 births Category:Living people Category:Actors from New York (state) Category:American television directors Category:Screenwriters from New York City Category:American voice actors Category:American television writers Category:People from Northport, New York
